content: rain rain go away … design and photos by anna mäkilä fb katse kantapäihin instagram @katse_kantapaihin i like autumn and i like rain but after a few rainy days i miss the sun then i need rain expelling socks rain rain go away … socks start at the cuff the pattern has a flap heel with the gusset decreases worked on the sole the result is diamond shaped gusset the pattern allows you to play with colors you can use only two colors as in orange socks three colors using different yarns for colorwork in chart a and chart b as in yellow socks or you can even knit each stripe of rain drops in different yarn note that this pattern has mirrored charts knit charts a and b for one sock charts c and d for the other one you will need fingering-weight sock yarn sample was knit in orange socks color 1 50 g of hand dyed yarn 75 % superwash wool 25 % polyamide 420 m / 100 g color 2 30 g of schoppel wolle zauberball yarn 75 % superwash wool 25 % polyamide 420 m / 100 g colorway stone washed yellow socks color 1 50 g of four seasons gründl hot socks neon yarn 75 % superwash wool 25 % polyamide 210 m / 50 g colorway gelb color 2 10 g of four seasons gründl hot socks neon yarn 75 % superwash wool 25 % polyamide 210 m / 50 g colorway blau color 3 20 g of drops fabel yarn 75 % superwash wool 25 % polyamide 205 m / 50 g colorway blue lagoon needles 2 0 and 2 25 mm or size needed to obtain correct gauge tapestry needle and 2 stitch markers the pattern is written for magic loop needles but you can use dpns or two circular needles as well 1 gauge 34 sts and 40 rds = 10 cm 4 inches in colorwork with larger needles sizes s m and l widths the length of both the leg and the foot is easy to adjust abbreviations c color k knit k tbl knit through the back loop k2tog - knit 2 sts together p purl p2tog - purl 2 sts together round s round s rs right side sl slip purlwise with yarn on ws sm stitch marker ssk my way slip 1 st knitwise yarn in back pass it back to left needle knit both sts together through the back loop st s stitch es ws wrong side * - * repeat leg with c1 and smaller needles cast on 66/72/78 sts divide stitches evenly over both needles and join to begin working in the round the beginning of the round will be at the back of the leg you will rearrange the stitches before the heel start ribbing *k1tbl p1* work ribbing for 15/16/17 rounds or until the cuff measures the desired length knit 2 round and change to larger needles if necessary to maintain
